p: Of the 74 positive samples, 56 were characterized as G3 and 18 as G1. While G3 sequences were detected in all the 9 years of monitoring ( Figure 3), G1 sequences were mainly detected in 2011–2012 (13 of 18; 72%). Thereafter, only five G1 samples were found between 2013 and 2016, while in the triennium 2017–2019 only G3 sequences were detected.
